context_evidences: - The original watermark on the bottom lefthand corner of the photo has also been cropped out in the altered version and the image has been flipped. Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/factcheck/2021/02/22/fact-check-viral-image-purported-blue-philippine-owl-doctored/4533533001/ published on 2021-01-31 00:00:00

- The owl photo was taken by Knut Eisermann, who is credited in a watermark over the image that reads "Owling.com ©2017 Knut Eisermann." "Alta Verapaz, Guatemala 5/2008," reads the photo's caption. "Knut took this nice photo of a Guatemalan Pygmy-Owl in the highlands of Guatemala." Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/factcheck/2021/02/22/fact-check-viral-image-purported-blue-philippine-owl-doctored/4533533001/ published on 2021-01-31 00:00:00
correction_response: This tweet is misleading. The image of the blue owl is actually a doctored photo. The original photo, taken by Knut Eisermann, features a brown owl, not a blue one. The image has been manipulated to give the owl blue feathers and pink eyes. The original watermark has also been cropped out and the image flipped. The claim that this is a "Philippines Blue owl" or an owl from Madagascar is false. The original photo is of a Guatemalan Pygmy-Owl taken in Guatemala. Here's the fact-check for reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/factcheck/2021/02/22/fact-check-viral-image-purported-blue-philippine-owl-doctored/4533533001/
note_1_text: There is no such thing as blue owl. It looks really good but unfortunately it's not true.     https://oneplanetonechild.org/are-blue-owls-real/#:~:text=Are%20Blue%20owls%20real%3F%20An%20image%20has%20been,a%20photo%20of%20a%20brown%20Guatemalan%20pygmy%20owl.
note_2_text: This is the work of an artist. It is not a real animal. This account frequently posts unattributed and mislabeled images.

refute_evidences: - The blue owl claim appears to have originated in various Pinterest posts that feature the photo alongside the caption, "Philippines Blue owl." Others have shared the same image on Pinterest claiming that it is an owl of Madagascar. Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/factcheck/2021/02/22/fact-check-viral-image-purported-blue-philippine-owl-doctored/4533533001/ published on 2021-01-31 00:00:00

- In the authentic photo, the owl has brown feathers; the altered photo has manipulated the image to give the owl bright blue feathers and pink eyes. Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/factcheck/2021/02/22/fact-check-viral-image-purported-blue-philippine-owl-doctored/4533533001/ published on 2021-01-31 00:00:00
